  • Uses of ChessPiece in board

    Subclasses of ChessPiece in board
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Bishop
    This class represents a Bishop
    class 
    King
    This class represents a King, a chess piece that can move in any direction but only one space
    class 
    Knight
    This class implements a Knight, chess piece that can only move 2 spaces in one direction and 1 space that is perpendicular to the aforementioned direction
    class 
    Pawn
    This class represents a Pawn
    class 
    Queen
    This class represents a Queen
    class 
    Rook
    This class represents a Rook

    Chessboard.ChessBoard
    the 2D array that will act as our chess board

    Bishop.Check​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)

    static boolean
    King.Check​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
    method to check if the King is being attacked by any piece, can also be used to decide if any piece can be captured
    static boolean
    Knight.Check​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
    determines if the specific space in [row][col] is being under attack by a knight
    static boolean

    This method checks there's any pawns attacking a specific space
    static boolean
    Rook.Check​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)

    static boolean
    King.CheckDown​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)

    King.CheckLowerRight​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)

    utilizes all above classes to determine if the King is in checkmate
    static boolean

    King.kingCheck​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
